intro: Stachytarpheta australis f. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered ironweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Australia. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, clustered inflorescences. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and showy blooms. The varietal form 'albiflora' is distinguished by its predominantly white floral display.
